DOC.brief_summary: Breast cancer tissue is collected from women undergoing scheduled surgery for breast cancer. The tissue specimen are analyzed by MR spectroscopy. After MR, the intact tissue specimen can be analyzed by other methods, such as histopathology. The MR spectral profiles are compared to clinical findings such as the patients diagnosis, lymph node status and tumor size.
DOC.brief_title: Magnetic Resonance (MR) Spectroscopy of Breast Cancer Tissue
